alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 06 at 9:55PM EST until March 14 at 10:49AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... White River. .Minor flooding is ongoing along the White river and several tributaries across central and southern Indiana due to 1.5 to 3 inches of rainfall that fell Friday March 3rd. Flooding is ongoing along the lower White River from Spencer to Hazleton, with the crest near Elliston. Flooding along many smaller tributaries that has not already ended will end by Tuesday. Flooding will continue through the middle to end of the week over much of the White river but into next week at Petersburg and Hazleton. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY, MARCH 14... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...Until Tuesday, March 14. * IMPACTS...At 21.3 feet, State Road 257 south of Washington began to flood during May 2008 after local rains of more than an inch on very wet soils with Petersburg at 21.3 feet and rising and Shoals at 15.5 feet and rising. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EST Monday /7:30 PM CST Monday/ the stage was 20.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM EST Monday /7:30 PM CST Monday/ was 20.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.7 feet Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
